conclusion: The gas follows the ideal gas law: PV = nRT.
Identify given information for state A and B.
State A: P_A = 3 x 10^5 Pa, V_A = 2 x 10^-3 m³, T_A = 27°C.
Convert T_A to Kelvin: T_A = 300.15 K.
State B: P_B = 2 x 10^5 Pa, V_B = 2 x 10^-3 m³.
Use the ideal gas law for state A: P_A V_A = n R T_A.
Use the ideal gas law for state B: P_B V_B = n R T_B.
Set up the ratio: (P_A V_A) / T_A = (P_B V_B) / T_B.
Substitute known values into the equation.
Simplify and solve for T_B: T_B = (4 x 300.15) / 6.
The temperature of the gas in state B is approximately 200.1 K.
